newsitem.title: FRANCE: France's Leotard confirms 75 bln French franc tax cut.
newsitem.headline: France's Leotard confirms 75 bln French franc tax cut.

text.p: Francois Leotard, president of France's UDF parliamentary party, said on Wednesday that the French government was planning to cut income taxes by 75 billion French francs ($14.74 billion) over the next five years.
"The prime minister said the cut in income taxes would be 75 billion francs in five years," Leotard said after a meeting with Prime Minister Alain Juppe.
Financial daily Les Echos said earlier on Wednesday that income tax cuts would total 65 to 75 billion over the next five years.
The newspaper said gross tax cuts would total about 100 billion francs, though part of that would be recouped through the elimination of some existing tax breaks. ($1=5.087 French Franc)
